channel.title: My little math application I made
channel.description:
ive been working on this for awhile took forever(not really, just a few hours) and i wanted to know if you guys think its any good? this is my attempt using java that i didnt pull out of a book.
theres no viruses its clean. its open source so you can see how i made it and it is kinda messy
i have all the updates inside (under File) of it so im not going to post here.
the sites menu just has links to moparisthebest and moparscape itll bring you to the sites when you click on them
other was just a fun thing i did its just alittle copy right i made =P
please post on what you think
Direct link from filefront.com (click download now) [url=http://dodownload.filefront.com/9639486//b7e3aee4ebd316bee45eb8a0bcb832533b31b07abff74b561c46be4bf573f8f24706d72e02421a96][IMG]http://static2.filefront.com/ffv6/graphics/b_download_still.gif[/img][/url]
heres a pic(flame moves in app) [IMG]http://i32.tinypic.com/2wnz9j7.jpg[/img]

item.title: My little math application I made
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:33, topic:181096”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=242476.msg2066853#msg2066853 date=1203501372]

Braces for a one line statement is a personal preference. Even if it is a code convention. Even in my Java book it says that you may use curly braces if you wish, it’s just a personal preference. I also like it because if I am going to add anything other statements in the braces are already there.

Anyways, I like this application, it looks good, good job.

thanks
and i could care less about conventions atm - gasps -
its not like your going to be put in jail but if i want a good job postion ill start using them

You won’t get a job position without them. I HIGHLY suggest you get in the habit of using them now. They are for your own good, not necessarily to follow standard.

yes i know that but i just turned 13 last month i dont think i should be worrying about a job quite yet

I’m 13. 14 in a month. I started when I was about a month from 11 years old. Age shouldn’t matter.
[/quote]

I agree with that completely. If you were smart enough to be even thinking about learning Java when you are 10-11 years old, that’s a good thing. Age has never affected anything that I’ve done because I don’t care about it.[/quote]
I don’t know if it was a good thing, but fuck it has helped me in technology (we do computers).
I mainly did because I was thinking of trying, and I got hurt and broke my leg. I then told io9 I was going to try SCAR, but he said there’s better options and stuff. I then told frank_ and he convinced me to try Java. I have pretty much enjoyed every bit of it from then.

Read full topic
item.source: My little math application I made

item.title: My little math application I made
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:32, topic:181096”][quote author=openice123 link=topic=242476.msg2066648#msg2066648 date=1203495812]

Braces for a one line statement is a personal preference. Even if it is a code convention. Even in my Java book it says that you may use curly braces if you wish, it’s just a personal preference. I also like it because if I am going to add anything other statements in the braces are already there.

Anyways, I like this application, it looks good, good job.

thanks
and i could care less about conventions atm - gasps -
its not like your going to be put in jail but if i want a good job postion ill start using them

You won’t get a job position without them. I HIGHLY suggest you get in the habit of using them now. They are for your own good, not necessarily to follow standard.

yes i know that but i just turned 13 last month i dont think i should be worrying about a job quite yet
[/quote]
I’m 13. 14 in a month. I started when I was about a month from 11 years old. Age shouldn’t matter.[/quote]

<3. Do not ever take crap from people who think you are too young to do something. I am 14, 15 in two months, and I am planning to take my Sun Java cert sometime in the summer. All you need is determination and then the proper coursework and you can accomplish great things… great things…

Read full topic

item.title: My little math application I made
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:22, topic:181096”][quote author=BAsh(CntLgn) link=topic=242476.msg2064712#msg2064712 date=1203430827]

Braces around one line statements are just personal preference, until you get a job that is, and then you do what your employer tells you.

Which will be to use braces.

Unless its on the same line.
[/quote]
No. I’d say an employer will tell you too use braces in all circumstances![/quote]

I don’t see why it would matter considering the employer will probably never worry about the code and therefore not care about conventions.

Read full topic

item.title: My little math application I made
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:17, topic:181096”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=242476.msg2060271#msg2060271 date=1203302743]

Instead of using that for launching URL’s you could use the java.awt.Desktop object.

if(Desktop.isDesktopSupported()) {
    Desktop.browse(new URI("http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php"));
}

You don’t need curly braces on an if statement if it’s only 1 line.

Woah. That was an… odd post.

But as Evil_ said, I believe it is much cleaner when using braces.

It’s also discouraged by the Java Conventions to do it that way! http://java.sun.com/docs/codeconv/html/CodeConventions.doc6.html#449

Yes, I know. But a lot of people do it…

yes, but just because it’s common doesn’t mean it’s right.

and just because it is convention doesn’t mean it is right either; plus, the conventions were made from many people doing the same thing
[/quote]
go ahead, don’t follow them, but be prepared for the e-drama you’ll recieve from java programmers.[/quote]
How about you stop jumping on the bandwagon and trying to enforce you opinions on others? If someone does not want to follow the JPC then that’s their fault.

Read full topic
item.source: My little math application I made

Instead of using that for launching URL’s you could use the java.awt.Desktop object.

if(Desktop.isDesktopSupported()) {
    Desktop.browse(new URI("http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php"));
}

You don’t need curly braces on an if statement if it’s only 1 line.

Woah. That was an… odd post.

But as Evil_ said, I believe it is much cleaner when using braces.

It’s also discouraged by the Java Conventions to do it that way! http://java.sun.com/docs/codeconv/html/CodeConventions.doc6.html#449

Yes, I know. But a lot of people do it…

yes, but just because it’s common doesn’t mean it’s right.
[/quote]

and just because it is convention doesn’t mean it is right either; plus, the conventions were made from many people doing the same thing[/quote]
go ahead, don’t follow them, but be prepared for the e-drama you’ll recieve from java programmers.
